element.name: Unit Disposition
element.definition: The patient disposition for an EMS event identifying whether patient contact was made.
element.v3Comment: Grouped with Incident and Transport dispositions. Who provided care or services is defined in Incident Dispostion.
element.v3Changes: Element added with the release of v3.5.0

facet.name: enumeration
facet.annotation: Cancelled Prior to Arrival at Scene

asserts.assert: Unit En Route Date/Time should be recorded unless Unit Disposition is "Cancelled Prior to Arrival at Scene".
Unit Arrived on Scene Date/Time should be recorded unless Unit Disposition is "Cancelled Prior to Arrival at Scene".
Arrived at Patient Date/Time should be recorded when Unit Disposition is "Patient Contact Made".
Unit Left Scene Date/Time should be recorded unless Unit Disposition is "Cancelled Prior to Arrival at Scene".
Number of Patients at Scene should be "Multiple" or "Single" when Unit Disposition is "Patient Contact Made".
Incident Location Type should be recorded unless Unit Disposition is "Cancelled Prior to Arrival at Scene".
Incident State should be recorded unless Unit Disposition is "Cancelled Prior to Arrival at Scene".
Incident ZIP Code should be recorded unless Unit Disposition is "Cancelled Prior to Arrival at Scene".
Incident County should be recorded unless Unit Disposition is "Cancelled Prior to Arrival at Scene".
Unit Disposition should be "Patient Contact Made" when Patient Evaluation/Care is "Patient Evaluated..." or "Patient Refused Evaluation/Care".
Unit Disposition should be "Patient Contact Made" when Crew Disposition contains "... Primary Care..." or "Provided Care Supporting Primary EMS Crew".
Unit Disposition should be "Patient Contact Made" when Transport Disposition is a value other than "Non-Patient Transport (Not Otherwise Listed)" or "No Transport".
Patient Evaluation/Care should be recorded when Unit Disposition is "Patient Contact Made".
Crew Disposition should be recorded when Unit Disposition is "Patient Contact Made".
Transport Disposition should be recorded when Unit Disposition is "Patient Contact Made".
